description.en: The MA seminar is structured in four parts covering four semesters. The first part consists of seminars training students for basic study and research skills (including how to approach your research topic, how to find relevant literature, how to read research literature, how to present your work in written and oral form, how to find and apply for conferences on your topic, etc.). The second part is more specifically aimed at training presentation and question&answer skills. In the third and fourth part students present their work in progress and give feedback to their peers. During the two semesters, specific seminars are held to provide professional insight and practical help with PhD and non-academic options after MA studies.
description.et: Magistriseminar koosneb neljast osast ja toimub nelja semestri vältel. Esimene osa sisaldab seminare, mis õpetavad põhilisi õppe- ja teadustöö oskusi (sh kuidas läheneda uurimisteemale, kuidas leida relevantset kirjandust, kuidas lugeda teaduslikku kirjandust, kuidas esitleda oma uurimistööd kirjalikult ja suuliselt, kuidas leida sobivateemalisi konverentse ning neile kandideerida jne). Teise osa eesmärk on spetsiifilisemalt harjutada esinemise ja küsimustele vastamise oskusi. Kolmandas ja neljandas osas teevad magistrandid oma uurimistööst ettekandeid ja annavad kursuskaaslastele tagasisidet. Samuti toimuvad teise õppeaasta jooksul seminarid, kus antakse erialaspetsiifilist infot ja praktilisi nõuandeid tulevasteks doktoriõpinguteks ja tutvustatakse mitteakadeemilise karjääri võimalusi pärast magistriõpingute lõpetamist..

objectives.en: The central aim is to develop a set of skills required for both successful Master's studies and for future academic and non-academic professional work. As it proceeds to the second part, the MA seminar is also a forum to present and discuss one's work in progress with peers and teachers in charge.
objectives.et: Aine peamine eesmärk on arendada oskusi, mis on vajalikud nii edukateks magistriõpinguteks kui toimetulekuks akadeemilisel ja mitteakadeemilisel tööturul. Alates MA seminari teisest osast saab seminarist ka foorum, kus esitada ja arutada oma uurimistöödtööd koos kursusekaaslaste ja vastutavate õppejõududega.

learning_outcomes.en: On successful completion of the course a student
- has practiced crucial skills for successful MA studies, such as essay writing skills
learning_outcomes.et: - on harjutanud edukateks magistriõpinguteks olulisi oskusi, nt essee kirjutamise oskust,

learning_outcomes.en: - has practiced crucial skills for successful research, such as defining a research problem, looking for relevant sources, etc.
learning_outcomes.et: - on harjutanud edukaks teadustööks olulisi oskusi, nt teadusküsimuse püstitamine, relevantsete allikate otsimine jne,

learning_outcomes.en: - has practiced presentation skills and question&answer routine
learning_outcomes.et: - on harjutanud  esinemisoskusi ja küsimustele vastamist,

learning_outcomes.en: - has learned how to write an abstract and a handout
- can provide feedback on the work of others
learning_outcomes.et: - oskab anda teiste töö kohta tagasisidet,

learning_outcomes.en: - has sufficient knowledge of academic and non-academic work options after MA studies
learning_outcomes.et: - omab piisavaid teadmisi akadeemilistest ja mitte-akadeemilistest edasiliikumise võimalustest pärast MA õpinguid,

learning_outcomes.en: - is in a position to apply to PhD programs in philosophy or related disciplines
learning_outcomes.et: - on võimeline kandideerima doktoriõppesse filosoofia või lähedasel erialal.

notes.et:
The MA seminar has to be attended for four semesters (both first and second year).

This seminar has been financed by the University of Tartu ASTRA Project PER ASPERA (European Regional Development Fund).

description.et:
Attendance, participation in discussions, presentation.
Attendance is compulsory. In case of missed attendance, you will need to compensate by writing a one-page commentary on the text presented.
After each session, some task will be given in order to apply the information and knowledge acquired.

All the students need to present their own work at least once.
In addition to presenting your own work at least once, everyone also has to be an opponent of one presentation by a fellow student.
